issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: QJM: Sychronize past log segments to JNs that missed them

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
During JN sync, a missing edit log is first downloaded from a remote JN to a tmp dir and then moved to the current directory (protected by the Journal's synchronization). 
Irrespective of whether the move succeeds or fails, we should delete the tmp file.
fields.summary: Handle IOException when transferring edit log to Journal current dir through JN sync

comments.body:
Thanks for the review [~arpitagarwal]. 
Addressed your comments in patch v02.

Thanks for the catch Arpit.
Fixed it in patch v03.
+1 for the v3 patch, pending Jenkins.
